title: Mastering Version Control with Git: A Practical Guide
description: Welcome to the world of Git! This course equips you with the skills to effectively manage your codebase using Git, the most popular version control system (VCS) for software development.

learning_outcomes.title: Version Control Fundamentals
learning_outcomes.content: Grasp the core concepts of version control systems and their role in tracking code changes, collaboration, and maintaining project history.

learning_outcomes.title: Introducing Git
learning_outcomes.content: Dive deep into Git, a distributed version control system, understanding its core philosophy and workflow.

learning_outcomes.title: Git Basics
learning_outcomes.content: Learn fundamental Git commands for initializing a repository, staging changes, committing changes, and viewing the commit history.

learning_outcomes.title: Working with Branches
learning_outcomes.content: Master the concept of branches in Git, allowing you to isolate development work and collaborate effectively. Explore creating, switching, merging, and rebasing branches.

learning_outcomes.title: Tracking Remote Repositories
learning_outcomes.content: Understand how to connect your local Git repository to a remote repository (e.g., GitHub) for collaboration and version control across teams. Learn to push, pull, and fetch code changes.

learning_outcomes.title: Resolving Conflicts
learning_outcomes.content: Explore techniques for resolving merge conflicts that might arise when collaborating on the same codebase using Git.

learning_outcomes.title: Advanced Git Features (Optional)
learning_outcomes.content: Delve into advanced topics like submodules, ignoring files with .gitignore, stashing changes, and using Git tags.

learning_outcomes.title: Git for Collaboration Platforms
learning_outcomes.content: Learn best practices for using Git with popular collaboration platforms like GitHub or GitLab, leveraging features like issue tracking and pull requests.
